result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J. Klentz

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Terry William Rose in court for Robert J. Klentz.  Attorney James T. Sempf in court for State of Wisconsin. Amy Fryman (Interpreter) and Sarah Voelker (captionist) appear duly sworn by clerk. Matter is on for a review hearing. Previous doctors report regarding incompetency and court found incompetent. Court addresses atty Rose and there is a report from Kenosha county which opines client is still incompetent to proceed.   Court addresses Mr. Klentz on competency. Based on defendant standing mute to questions, court finds defendant not competent. Court addresses Atty Sempf. Proceeding continued to be stayed, reports at 3 month intervals. Proceedings stayed pending 6 month report. 
Court in recess at 240 pm
Review hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Letter from defense regarding report filed in Kenosha county
*Let's set a review hearing. DSJ
**emailed parties (ko)

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert J. Klentz in court, in custody.  ASL Interpreter Kate Block sworn by clerk. Attorney Terry William Rose in court for Robert J. Klentz. Defendant was found not competent in Kenosha Co. State agrees that the court can rely on the report from Kenosha Co. Court has colloquy with defendant. Court agrees that defendant is not competent at this time. Defendant is awaiting a bed at the institution. Court does not set review hearing at this time. Minutes filed.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

1:15 PM Case called. Attorney Terry William Rose in court for Robert J. Klentz. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. ASL interpreter Kate Block and captionist Sarah Voelker appear and duly sworn by clerk.
Writ was not prepared for the deft. 
State to prepare Writ for next time. 
AIA set for June 17, 2022 @ 1:15pm, 2464. 
Court to set up ASL interpreters. 
Atty Rose states the deft may be in Kenosha or Madison.
Competency Report from Kenosha county case
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): M.E.A. dob 11/24/2008 or RESIDENCE OR ANY MINORS. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert J. Klentz in court with atty Terry Rose, in custody by video.  Attorney Terry William Rose in court for Robert J. Klentz. Motion filed regarding competency, Attorney Rose is requesting an interpreter for future hearings. Court finds there is a reason to doubt defendant's competency to proceed and ORDERS A COMPETENCY EXAMINATION - Sec. 971.14. Recent report on file, CT will have separate. Hearing date is to be set after Report is filed. Judge's clerk to set. Minutes filed.
